definition: rent for a room or house
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax

sentences.english: he pays, I think, about two thousand dollars a month.
He has a little room on the Rue Condorcet for which he pays sixty francs a month.
sentences.chinese: 他在孔多塞街有一問小房子，每月付六十法郎房租。

sentences.english: QinQiong clemson is already in debt for seven days of the rent money not to.
sentences.chinese: 秦瓊囊中羞澀，已經欠了七天的房租錢未給。

sentences.english: After lodger and landlord meet, fu Qi of the rest chummage.
sentences.chinese: 房客與房東見面之後，將剩餘的房租付齊。

sentences.english: The rent was fifty-five dollars, with clothes and extras a varying sum.
sentences.chinese: 房租是五十五元，衣服和零用沒有定數。

sentences.english: He told me I had to start paying rent, or move out.
sentences.chinese: 他說我得開始付房租，要麼就搬出去。

sentences.english: On the one hand the hotel is near the sea, but on the other hand it costs a lot.
sentences.chinese: 好的方面是這家旅館靠海，可是另一方面房租太貴。

sentences.english: A laboring man needs bread and butter, and cash to pay the rent.
sentences.chinese: 勞動者需要麪包和黃油，也要錢付房租。

sentences.english: Monthly paid rent, car park available.
sentences.chinese: 房租月付，帶停車位，長短期租住皆可。

sentences.english: I have to pay next month's rent.
sentences.chinese: 我還得付下個月的房租。

sentences.english: Pay the bills, including the gas, electricity, and the rent.
sentences.chinese: 支付各種各樣的費用包括水電費，煤氣費，房租。

sentences.english: At least prices in America are back to their long-run average compared with rents (see article).
sentences.chinese: 與房租相比，至少美國的房價已回落至長期均勻值。

sentences.english: If you don't pay your rent you'll be evicted from the house.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不付房租，你全被趕出這所房子。

sentences.english: The landlady turned out a tenant for not paying the rent .
sentences.chinese: 女房東趕走了一名不交房租的房客。

sentences.english: At the very least, Carol should be paying rent and taking care of her dogs, meals and laundry.
sentences.chinese: 至少，凱羅應該付房租，照料自己的狗，做飯和洗衣。

definition: to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax
to rent jointly with other people/co-renting
